context_of_use: This use case is applicable in the context of managing customer orders within the system.
scope: The scope includes the review and approval or rejection of pending orders by managers.
description: Allows managers to review and approve or reject pending orders to progress business workflows.
triggering_event: A manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending orders to be approved.
postconditions: The order is either approved or rejected.
The order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
requirements_met: The manager can view pending orders.
The manager can approve or reject orders.
main_flow: 1. Manager logs into the system → System authenticates the manager.
2. Manager views pending orders → System displays the list of pending orders.
3. Manager selects an order to approve or reject → System updates the order status accordingly.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 3): If the manager decides to reject the order, the system prompts for a reason for rejection.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If authentication fails, the system displays an error message.
information_for_steps: 2. List of pending orders with details.
